description: An MCP server for managing your calendar, via Clockwise

tools.name: search_events

tools.name: fetch_events
tools.title: Fetch Event Details
tools.description:
Fetch events by their IDs from specific calendars. This tool takes a map of calendar IDs to lists of event IDs and fetches the full event details for each event.

    This is useful when you have event IDs from previous search_events calls and want to get the complete event information including all details, such as description, location, attendees, and metadata.

    Input: A map where keys are calendar IDs (email addresses) and values are arrays of event IDs (externalEventId)
    Output: A map where keys are calendar IDs and values are arrays of simplified event objects

eventsByCalendar.description: Map from calendar ID (email) to array of event IDs to fetch from that calendar

tools.name: search_people
tools.title: Search People and Teams
tools.description:
Search for persons, teams, and groups in the organization using fuzzy string matching.

    IMPORTANT NOTES:
    - Returns multiple potential matches for each search term using fuzzy string matching
    - Automatically select the most appropriate match when there's a clear match, and ask for disambiguation when it is not clear. 
    - The tool provides team information as a fallback to help identify users
    - Returns both direct matches and team-based suggestions

    Input Parameters:
    - names: List of individual person names to search for (e.g., "John Smith", "Sarah", "Mike") - use fuzzy search on actual people's first/last names, not job titles or team names
    - teams_groups: List of team or group names to search
    - include_my_teams: Boolean to include all teams the current user belongs to (useful for discovering available teams without knowing their names).

    Response Structure:
    - Direct results for each search term (may include fuzzy matches with varying quality)
    - Suggestions if no direct matches found
    - For each person: userId, calendarId, full name, profile info
    - For teams: team_id, team_name, members list
    - my_info: Always includes current user's information (userId, calendarId)

    Returns essential IDs:
    - userId: Internal ID for use with fetch_people_by_id
    - primaryCalendarId: Email/calendar ID for scheduling

    Usage Tips:
    - Automatically select obvious correct matches (exact name matches or clearly intended person) without asking for disambiguation
    - Only ask for disambiguation when multiple results are genuinely ambiguous with similar match quality (e.g., "John Smith" and "John Davis" both match equally well for "John")
    - Use match quality assessment: exact matches > partial matches > fuzzy similarity matches
    - When fuzzy matching returns unrelated results, ignore the poor matches and proceed with obvious correct matches
    - For initials or short names, check the team member list in the response
    - Consider both the name match quality and context clues like teams and roles when determining the best match automatically
    - Use returned userId with fetch_people_by_id for detailed information
    - Use calendarId/email for scheduling with create_proposal
    - Use include_my_teams=true to discover all teams you belong to
    - For team searches, use keywords rather than full names: "marketing" finds teams better than "marketing team"

names.description: List of individual person names to search for

teams_groups.description: List of team or group names to search for

include_my_teams.description: Whether to include all teams the current user belongs to. Useful for discovering available teams without knowing their names.

tools.name: fetch_people_by_id
tools.title: Fetch User Details
tools.description:
Fetches detailed context for users given their internal user IDs (obtained from search_people results). If no user IDs are provided, it fetches information for the current user.
      Returns comprehensive information including:
      - Working hours (timezone, daily schedules, overrides)
      - Calendar preferences and goals (focus time targets, lunch preferences, meeting style)
      - Team membership and colleagues
      - Job function and role (when available)
      - Scheduling preferences (preferred work times, end-of-day preferences)

      If fetching for the current user, also includes:
      - Descriptions of calendars relevant to the user

      Input: List of internal user IDs (e.g., ["e7e0f7dad0914f43ae1f4409f34e4c08"])
      Output: Dictionary keyed by user ID with detailed user context

      Use this after search_people to get in-depth information about attendees before scheduling meetings or to understand their work patterns.

userIds.description: An optional list of user IDs to fetch information for. If not provided, fetches information for the current user.

includeCurrentUser.description: Whether to include the current user in the results.

showWorkingHoursOverlap.description: Whether to include working hours overlap analysis.

tools.name: update_preferences
tools.title: Update User Preferences
tools.description:
Update the user's preferences for focus time, lunch, meeting relief, preferred work time, working hours, meeting hours, timezone, and additional scheduling preferences.

This tool allows you to modify:
- Focus time preferences (ideal minutes per week/day, minimum minutes per week, auto-decline settings)
- Lunch preferences (time slot range, duration)
- Meeting relief settings (fatigue threshold, break duration)
- Preferred work time (morning/afternoon preference, work days, keep start/end open)
- Working hours (timezone, daily schedules for base work hours)
- Meeting hours (timezone, daily schedules for meeting availability)
- User timezone (e.g., 'America/New_York', 'Europe/London', 'Asia/Tokyo')
- Additional preferences (map of preference tags to values, e.g., { 'my_team': 'alice, bob, chris', 'preferred_hours': '9-5' })

IMPORTANT:
- additionalPreferences performs an UPSERT operation that will OVERWRITE all existing additional preferences.
To update additional preferences safely:
1. **ALWAYS use fetch_people_by_id first** to retrieve the user's current additional preferences
2. Merge your new preferences with the existing ones
3. Use "Replace" action with the complete merged set of preferences

All parameters are optional - only the ones you specify will be updated.

idealMinutesPerWeek.description: Ideal focus time minutes per week

idealMinutesPerDay.description: Ideal focus time minutes per day

minMinutesPerWeek.description: If autodeclineIfMinimumNotMet is true, the minimum focus time minutes per week before auto-declining is enabled

autodeclineIfMinimumNotMet.description: Whether to auto-decline if minimum focus time isn't met

min.description: Start time for lunch slot (24-hour format)

max.description: End time for lunch slot (24-hour format)

meetingFatigueThresholdMinutes.description: Minutes of meetings before relief break is needed

meetingReliefBreakMinutes.description: Duration of relief break in minutes

preferredWorkDays.description: Preferred work days of the week. Workdays are generally Monday through Friday, don't include Saturdays or Sundays unless they are explicitly mentioned.

keepStartOfDayOpen.description: Whether to keep the start of the day open

keepEndOfDayOpen.description: Whether to keep the end of the day open

preferredWork.description: Preferred work time preferences to update

day.description: Days of the week the user is working. Workdays are generally Monday through Friday, don't include Saturdays or Sundays unless they are explicitly mentioned.

excludedSlots.description: Slots that are excluded from the working hours. Only include slots that are explicitly excluded within the min and max slot.

workingHours.description: Working hours preferences to update (Base type)

day.description: Days of the week the user is working. Workdays are generally Monday through Friday, don't include Saturdays or Sundays unless they are explicitly mentioned.

excludedSlots.description: Slots that are excluded from the working hours. Only include slots that are explicitly excluded within the min and max slot.

meetingHours.description: Meeting hours preferences to update (Meeting type)

additionalPreferences.description: UPSERT OPERATION: This will overwrite ALL existing additional preferences. Use fetch_people_by_id first to get current preferences, then merge with new ones before calling this tool. Map of preference tags to preference values (e.g., { 'my_team': 'alice, bob, chris', 'preferred_schedule': '9-5', 'other': 'any other preferences' }). Preferences are sent to the backend as 'tag: value' strings.

tools.name: set_calendar_description
tools.title: Set Calendar Description

Set or update the description for a specific calendar identified by its email/calendar ID.
  Use this description to keep track of anything you learn about the calendar, or anything the user wants to remember about it.

tools.name: create_proposal
tools.title: Create Meeting Proposal
tools.description:
Manage multiple meetings with different operations in a single request. This can include scheduling new events, updating or rescheduling existing events, or cancelling existing events. Returns a proposal for the given changes, including a link to view in the Clockwise app.

    IMPORTANT: ALL parameters are optional unless explicitly required. When parameters are omitted, Clockwise automatically chooses intelligent defaults based on the user's preferences, calendar settings, and availability patterns. Do NOT ask users for meeting details - instead, provide broad timeranges and let Clockwise optimize.

    When scheduling meetings:
    - Give Clockwise the widest possible timeranges (multiple days/weeks) so Clockwise can find optimal times
    - Clockwise sees everyone's calendars and will automatically choose the best time for all attendees
    - Only specify explicit start and end times when the user explicitly requests them, for example when the user wants to schedule a meeting at an exact time or they want to block off a specific time range, such as a full morning or afternoon.
    - Omit titles, durations, descriptions, and other details unless explicitly requested - Clockwise will choose appropriate defaults

    When updating or cancelling existing events, use eventIds (e.g., from a previous search_events call).

    IMPORTANT: When scheduling meetings with teams, you must first use search_people to identify individual team members before creating the proposal. The create_proposal tool cannot resolve team names directly - it only accepts individual person names or calendar IDs.

    When scheduling meetings with people or teams, use the search_people tool first to identify attendees and get their calendar IDs.

tools.name: confirm_proposal
tools.title: Confirm Meeting Proposal
tools.description:
Confirm the given proposal after the user has reviewed and approved it. This is the final step in the scheduling process and should be called only after explicit user confirmation.
    ALWAYS prompt the user with the specific event details and get a clear confirmation from the user—such as "Yes, that looks good"—before calling this tool. DO NOT INFER CONFIRMATION. NEVER CALL THIS WITHOUT EXPLICIT USER CONFIRMATION.

proposal_id.description: ID of the proposal to confirm

has_user_viewed_proposal.description: Boolean that must be True to proceed with confirmation. This is a safety measure to ensure the user explicitly wants to confirm the proposal.

Cancel the given proposal. This will remove the proposal and any associated scheduling changes.
    Always prompt the user with the specific event details and get a clear confirmation—such as "Yes, that looks good"—before calling this tool. DO NOT INFER CONFIRMATION.

proposal_id.description: ID of the proposal to cancel

tools.name: optimize_schedule
tools.title: Optimize Calendar Schedule
tools.description:
Automatically reorganize your entire calendar by moving existing meetings to create a better overall schedule within your current working hours and preferences.

    Use this when you want to:
    - Fix a chaotic week by reorganizing existing meetings
    - Create more focus time by consolidating meeting times  
    - Resolve conflicts across your entire calendar
    - Optimize an overloaded schedule without canceling meetings

    DO NOT USE for:
    - Moving just 1-2 specific meetings
    - Moving specific meetings to different times
    - Accommodating timezone changes
    - Rescheduling around specific constraints or conflicts
    - Making targeted adjustments to individual meetings
    For these cases, use search_events + create_proposal instead
    Note: This tool only suggests moving existing meetings. To schedule new meetings, update specific meetings, or cancel meetings, use create_proposal instead.

    This tool analyzes ALL meetings in the date range and suggests moving them to better times based on your existing timezone, working hours, and calendar preferences. It returns a comprehensive reorganization proposal.
    
    The tool returns:
    - A detailed proposal showing which meetings to move and why
    - A summary of improvements (focus time gained, conflicts resolved, etc.)
    - A link to review the full proposal in Clockwise before applying changes

    You can customize the optimization based on the following goals:
    - meeting_movement: Controls how much we should move existing meetings to optimize the schedule
      - 1: Minimal - minimize meeting movement (events are only moved for high priority reasons such as to resolve conflicts)
      - 2: Balanced approach
      - 3: Maximum - allow maximum movement of events to optimize the schedule
    
    - meeting_density: Adjusts how Clockwise spaces or clusters your meetings throughout the day.
      - 1: Spread out meetings throughout the week, breaking up back to back meetings to allow more breaks and meeting relief
      - 2: Balanced approach (medium weights)
      - 3: Cluster meetings together to optimize for Focus Time and No Meeting Days

    - consideration_level: Adjusts how much we consider your team's needs versus your own when optimizing your schedule
      - 1: Prioritize my time
      - 2: Balanced
      - 3: Adapt for the team

    Returns a proposal containing suggested meeting moves, including a link to view the proposal in the Clockwise app. This link should be displayed to the user so they can review the proposal online.
    The returned proposal ID can be passed to other tools in this MCP server.

meeting_movement.description: Controls how much to move existing meetings (1, 2, or 3, default: 2). 1=Minimal, 2=Balanced, 3=aggressive optimization

meeting_density.description: Controls meeting density preferences (1, 2, or 3, default: 2). 1=Spread out, 2=Balanced, 3=Clustered

consideration_level.description: Consideration level (1, 2, or 3, default: 2). 1=Prioritize my time, 2=balanced, 3=Adapt for the team

tools.name: fetch_calendar_stats
tools.title: Fetch Calendar Analytics
tools.description:
Fetch calendar analytics data for specified calendar IDs by week. Analyzes calendar patterns and time allocation.

    This tool provides insights into time distribution, including:
    - Meeting vs focus time breakdown
    - Calendar density and fragmentation analysis  
    - Time allocation patterns by day of week

    Returns aggregated statistics for the requested historical period:
    - Overall metrics: focusMinutes, busyMinutes, fragmentedMinutes, totalMinutes
    - scoresByDay: Aggregated totals by day of week (e.g., total focus minutes across all Mondays)
    - scoresByDate: Daily breakdown for each date in the range

    
    IMPORTANT: Time range must be less than 27 weeks in duration. If you need to fetch data over a longer period of time, split into multiple call of this tool with different time ranges.

    Uses the user's timezone for all calculations. If no calendar IDs provided, defaults to the current user's calendar. If no date range provided, defaults to the current week (Monday to Sunday).

calendarIds.description: List of calendar IDs to fetch statistics for. Each calendar ID should be a valid email address or calendar identifier. If not provided, fetches stats for the current user's calendar.

startDate.description: Start date for the statistics period (YYYY-MM-DD format)

endDate.description: End date for the statistics period (YYYY-MM-DD format)

tools.name: get_scheduling_links
tools.title: Get Scheduling Links
tools.description: Get all scheduling links for the current user.

tools.name: create_scheduling_link
tools.title: Create Scheduling Link
tools.description:
Create a scheduling link with the provided meeting settings. Returns the link and a summary
    availability text with suggested times to be shown to the user to share their availability.
    Start with the defaults for all settings that have defaults.

name.description:
Display name for the scheduling link. This will be used in the title of the scheduling link
      and the created event, so make it short but descriptive. If no other details are provided, use a default name such as "Meeting with <Name>".

description.description: Optional description for the scheduling link.

durations.description:
The option for meeting duration that will be presented by the scheduling link. The selected
      option determines the length of the meeting that will be created. This field is an array of
      available meeting durations in minutes, e.g. [30, 60]. Default is [30, 60].

defaultDuration.description: Default duration in minutes, e.g. 30. Default is 30.

anyOf.description:
The time range is a rolling window, which means the link can create meetings from now until a
      fixed number of days in the future.

startDate.description: The start date of the time range.

endDate.description: The end date (inclusive) of the time range.

anyOf.description:
The time range is a fixed range of dates, which means the link can create meetings over a
      fixed range of dates.

timeRange.description: The time range over which meetings can be created with the link.

timingSettings.description:
Timing settings for the scheduling link. durations and defaultDuration control the length of
      the meeting that can be created by the link. periodType and timeRange determine the time range
      over which the meetings can be created by the link.

locationType.description:
Type of meeting location: Meet for Google Meet, Zoom for Zoom. InDescription means the
      location will be provided in the meeting settings description field.

calendarId.description: Calendar ID of the link member.

isRequired.description:
Whether this member is required for the meeting. The link will only present meeting
            times when all required members are available. This is ignored for round robin links. By
            default, use true.

schedulingPriority.description:
Round robin scheduling priority for this member. This is only applicable to round
              robin links and is required in that case.  HIGH is the highest priority, and LOW is
              the lowest priority. If a meeting time is selected where multiple members are
              available, a higher-priority member will be selected to attend before a lower-priority
              member. DO_NOT_SCHEDULE means this member will never be selected to attend. By
              default, set all members to priority HIGH.

linkMembers.description:
Attendees to include in this link. If the current user is not included, they will be
      automatically added as required. If they are not required, make sure to include them as
      optional.

isActive.description:
Whether the link is active or inactive. This must not be set when the link is created, since
      all newly-created links are active.

anyOf.description: Use the attendees' working hours as the bookable hours for the link.
Use the attendees' meeting hours as the bookable hours for the link.

respectNonOwnerConstraints.description:
Also respect the working and meeting hours of all required attendees when determining
              available times. If true, the available hours will be the intersection of the custom
              hours and the working and meeting hours of all required attendees. If false, only the
              custom hours will be considered when determining available times.

items.description:
A time range within the day during which a link may be scheduled. Times are interpreted in the
    time zone of the user that owns the link.

schedule.description:
A weekly schedule for the bookable hours, specifying available time ranges for each day
          of the week.

dateOverrides.description: Overrides for the weekly schedule, specifying available time ranges for specific dates.

anyOf.description: Use the provided custom time ranges as the bookable hours for the link.

bookableHours.description:
Determines the time ranges that are available to be scheduled
    with the given link. Working and meeting hours are evaluated for all required attendees on the
    link. WorkingHours is not available for group links. By default, use MeetingHours.

availabilityType.description:
Use MaximizeFocusTime to only show meeting times that won't interfere with your focus time blocks. This protects your deep work but may limit scheduling options.
      Use MaximizeAvailability to show all possible meeting times without considering focus time impact. This gives the most scheduling options.
      BalanceAvailabilityAndFocus shows all available times but labels those that would conflict with focus time as "inconvenient." This gives people options while highlighting which times are better for you.
      By default, use BalanceAvailabilityAndFocus. Round robin links must use MaximizeAvailability.

bookOnNoMeetingDay.description: If true, allow scheduling meetings on the user's no-meeting days.

highlightBestTimes.description:
If true, the scheduling link will highlight the best available times based on the user's
      preferences and availability.

allowFifteenMinuteMarkBooking.description:
If true, allow booking meetings that start at 15-minute marks (e.g., 9:15, 9:45). If false,
      meetings may only start at 30-minute marks.

bookingTimeBufferHours.description: The minimum number of hours between when a meeting is booked and when it can start.

isRequired.description: This question must be answered for the meeting to be scheduled.

type.description:
ShortText for a single-line text response, LongText for a multi-line text response,
      PhoneNumber for a phone number response.

question.description: The text of the question to ask the attendee.

attendeeQuestions.description:
List of questions to ask the attendee when they are booking the meeting. These questions will
      be presented on the booking page and the responses will be included in the event
      description.

bookingLimit.description:
The maximum number of meetings that can be booked using this link. If not set, there is no
      limit.

allowAdditionalAttendees.description:
If true, the person booking the meeting can add additional attendees beyond those specified
      in linkMembers.

titleTemplate.description:
An optional template for the event title. This can include variables enclosed in double curly
      braces. The following variables are supported:
      - link_name: The name of the link.
      - organizer.display_name: The display name (full name) of the organizer (the user that owns the
        link).
      - organizer.email: The email address of the organizer.
      - schedular.display_name: The display name (full name) of the person booking the meeting.
      - scheduler.email: The email address of the person booking the meeting.
      - attendees: A comma-separated list of the display names of all attendees, including the
        organizer and the scheduler.

textOnlyTitle.description: If true, omit extra emojis or special characters from the event title.

maxBookingsPerDay.description:
The maximum number of meetings that may be booked on a given day with this link. If
    not specified, there is no daily limit. Both maxBookingsPerDay and maxBookingsPerWeek may be
    specified.

maxBookingsPerWeek.description:
The maximum number of meetings that may be booked on a given week with this link. If
    not specified, there is no weekly limit. Both maxBookingsPerDay and maxBookingsPerWeek may be
    specified.

roundRobinScheduling.description:
For links with multiple members, whether to use round-robin scheduling to distribute
    meetings evenly among the members. If false, the link will always schedule meetings with all
    required members. If true, the link will only schedule meetings with one member at a time,
    distributing meetings evenly among them based on their schedulingPriority.  This is only
    applicable to links with multiple members. By default, use false.

meetingSettings.description: Meeting settings configuration for the scheduling link.

tools.name: select_scheduling_time
tools.title: Select Scheduling Time
tools.description:
Select a specific time for a proposal by providing a start time. Returns a proposal for a meeting. The user must view the proposal and provide explicit approval before it can be confirmed.
    IMPORTANT: CALLING THIS TOOL DOES NOT CONSTITUTE CONFIRMATION OF THE PROPOSAL. YOU MUST ASK AND WAIT FOR EXPLICIT CONFIRMATION BEFORE CALLING confirm_proposal.

proposalId.description: ID of the proposal to edit

startTime.description: local ISO string for the new start time of the event (without a time zone, e.g., '2025-08-27T14:30:00')

endTime.description: Optional! local ISO string for the new end time of the event (without a time zone, e.g., '2025-08-27T15:30:00'). If not provided, will be calculated from event duration.
